> centuryfitness.com there are about 4 hand forged katanas for
about 300-500$ (depending on wich one you want) i have the one for
350$ and it is well worth my money it holds a NICE edge & will flex
over 3" before bending but its not like a cheap replica you have to
take care of it lol and just a warning fingerprints left on it
overnight WILL stay on it forever (its like rust)

messages.subject: Re: Chokuto Sword (fao Clive) or any one that can help
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dear Fodder - During my breif time in Japan I do not recall ever seeing quality replicas of Chokuto. However there were Chokuto submitted for the
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "cannonfodder_1980"
<cannonfodder_1980@...> wrote:
>
> Is there any where you know off that sell v'good replicas or new
> japanese made Chokuto swords of very good quality, I would very would
> like one for my collection and i guess that a original one would be
> beyond my budget
>
> Thanks For Any Advise
>

Dear Fodder -
During my breif time in Japan I do not recall ever seeing quality
replicas of Chokuto. However there were Chokuto submitted for the
Shinsakuto competitions, those I am afraid might cost you as much as
the originals. Still if you have to have one I would look to the modern
swordmakers,
-t
www.ncjsc.org

messages.subject: Chokuto Sword (fao Clive) or any one that can help
messages.msgSnippet: Is there any where you know off that sell v good replicas or new japanese made Chokuto swords of very good quality, I would very would like one for my
messages.messageBody:
Is there any where you know off that sell v'good replicas or new
japanese made Chokuto swords of very good quality, I would very would
like one for my collection and i guess that a original one would be
beyond my budget

Thanks For Any Advise
